words.example: The river is the main source of water for the city.
Please read the manual before using the machine.

words.meaning: vi. 获得成功，达到目的
安全的；平安的 n. (C)保险柜

words.example: You need a password to log into the system.
He is aware of the risks of using AI too much.

words.meaning: vt. 使能够；使成为可能
完整的，完全的 vt. 完成，结束
从……以来；自从 conj. 从……以来；由于；既然
令人惊讶地；出乎意料地
words.example: Surprisingly, he agreed to help us without hesitation.
The king sat proudly on his throne.
A long shadow appeared on the wall.
The dog began to approach the house slowly.
Her heart skipped a beat when she saw the shadow.

words.meaning: vt. 防止，预防；阻止，阻挡

words.example: He used a torch to see in the dark cave.
The spacecraft was launched successfully into space.
A beam of light shone through the window.
He used a flashlight to see in the dark.

words.meaning: 冷静的；沉着的 t. 使平静
当地的；地方的 n. (C)本地人

words.example: Failure is often the first step toward success.

words.meaning: 可再生的 可更新的
words.example: Solar power is a renewable source of energy.
Curiosity drives people to explore the unknown.

words.meaning: 扮演；表演 n. 行动
过度使用；过度使用的行为
words.example: We should not overuse AI when doing our homework.
You should use the Internet wisely.
The package arrived this morning.
He secretly followed the king into the garden.

phrases.meaning: 在我看来 依我之见
phrases.example: In my opinion, learning from mistakes is very important.
You should be aware of the risks before making a decision.
They set out for Beijing early in the morning.

phrases.meaning: 游戏结束 比喻事情彻底结束
phrases.example: When the time ran out, the screen showed Game over.
When the bell rang, the teacher said, Class over.
He looked around but saw nobody.
She put on weight after the holiday.
We had fun at the party last night.
We had a good time at the party.
If you keep eating junk food, you may end up unhealthy.
It turned out that he was right.

phrases.meaning: 放学了；上课结束（school 表示上学这一活动）
phrases.example: School over, the students ran out of the classroom.
He cried out in pain after he hurt his leg.

grammar.title: 现在完成时
grammar.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在造成的影响或结果，也表示从过去持续到现在的动作或状态。
grammar.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 表示过去的动作对现在的影响：I have lost my key. (现在没有钥匙)
表示经历：Have you ever been to Beijing?
表示持续到现在的状态：I have lived here for 10 years.
常与already, yet, just, ever, never, for, since连用

mistakes.explanation: have/has后面要用动词的过去分词形式

mistakes.wrong: I have bought this book yesterday.
mistakes.explanation: 有具体过去时间（yesterday），不能用现在完成时

mistakes.wrong: He has gone to Beijing for 3 days.
mistakes.correct: He has been in Beijing for 3 days.
mistakes.explanation: have gone表示去了还没回来，不能与for连用

examples: She has already finished her homework.
I have never met him before.
We have known each other since 2020.

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时的基本结构
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生并对现在有影响
usage: 强调结果或经验

sub_topics.title: have/has + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: 构成现在完成时。
usage: 表示完成或经验

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时结构
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生并影响现在的动作
usage: 经验
结果
持续

sub_topics.title: have + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时结构（have/has + 过去分词）
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在有影响
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 强调结果或经历
常与 already, ever 连用

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在产生影响
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 表示已完成的动作
表示经验或结果

grammar.title: 形容词/副词比较级
grammar.definition: 用于两者之间的比较，表示'更...'的意思。
grammar.structure: 形容词/副词比较级 + than / more + 形容词/副词原级 + than
usage: 单音节和部分双音节词：加-er（tall→taller, big→bigger）
多音节和部分双音节词：more + 原级（beautiful→more beautiful）
不规则变化：good/well→better, bad/badly→worse, many/much→more
比较级的修饰词：much, a lot, even, still, a little

mistakes.wrong: She is more taller than me.
mistakes.explanation: tall是单音节词，用-er形式，不需要more

mistakes.wrong: He runs more fast than me.

mistakes.correct: This book is better / much better.
mistakes.explanation: good的比较级是better，不能用more修饰

examples: My sister is two years older than me.
This question is more difficult than that one.
He works much harder than before.

sub_topics.title: 比较级递增结构（more and more）
sub_topics.definition: 表示程度不断加深，意为“越来越……”。
sub_topics.structure: more and more + 形容词/副词
usage: 描述变化趋势
常用于抽象概念
examples: The weather is getting more and more cold.
English is becoming more and more important.

sub_topics.title: 比较级用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示两者之间的比较
sub_topics.structure: 形容词/副词比较级 + than
usage: 比较两个人或事物
强调程度变化
examples: This book is more interesting than that one.

grammar.title: 一般过去时
grammar.definition: 表示过去某一时间发生的动作或存在的状态，也表示过去经常或反复发生的动作。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 动词过去式（be动词用was/were）
usage: 表示过去发生的动作：I visited my grandma yesterday.
表示过去存在的状态：He was a teacher ten years ago.
表示过去的习惯：When I was young, I often played football.

mistakes.wrong: I go to Beijing last year.
mistakes.correct: I went to Beijing last year.
mistakes.explanation: 有过去时间标志词（last year），动词要用过去式

examples: She bought a new dress yesterday.
They were happy at the party.
I didn't watch TV last night.

sub_topics.title: 一般过去时的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作
usage: 与过去时间状语连用

sub_topics.title: 不规则动词变化（ABB型、AAA型）
sub_topics.definition: 部分动词变化不规则
usage: 需单独记忆

sub_topics.title: 第三人称单数用法
sub_topics.definition: pr.邀请某人做某事

sub_topics.title: 第三人称单数
sub_topics.definition: 第三人称单数作主语的规则
usage: 一般现在时

sub_topics.title: 不规则动词变化（grow-grew-grown）
sub_topics.definition: grow的三种形式变化
usage: 需记忆

sub_topics.title: 不规则动词变化
sub_topics.definition: 部分动词的过去式和过去分词不按规则变化。
sub_topics.structure: 动词原形 → 不规则变化
usage: 需单独记忆

sub_topics.title: 动词过去式和过去分词的区别
sub_topics.definition: 过去式用于一般过去时，过去分词用于完成时或被动语态。
usage: 区分时态和语态

sub_topics.title: 动词过去式与过去分词（grow-grew-grown）
sub_topics.definition: grow是不规则动词。
usage: 区分时态

sub_topics.title: 规则动词与不规则动词
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: 动词原形与三单形式
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: 动词原形/过去式/过去分词的区分（grow–grew–grown）
sub_topics.definition: 同一动词在不同时态和语态中的不同形式
sub_topics.structure: 原形 / 过去式 / 过去分词
usage: 一般时态 vs 完成/被动

sub_topics.title: 动词原形与过去式判断
规则与不规则变化
sub_topics.definition: 英语动词在变成过去式和过去分词时，有规则变化和不规则变化两种情况。
sub_topics.structure:
规则动词：动词原形 + ed / d
不规则动词：形式需单独记忆
usage: 规则动词过去式和过去分词形式一致
不规则动词变化形式不统一，需要单独记忆
过去式常用于一般过去时
过去分词常用于现在完成时和被动语态

grammar.title: 可数名词语不可数名词
keywords: 可数名词语不可数名词
grammar.definition: 可数名词语不可数名词
grammar.structure: 可数名词与不可数名词

sub_topics.title: 可数名词与不可数名词
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: 连词and连接并列句
sub_topics.definition: and用于连接并列成分或句子
usage: 表示顺承或并列
examples: I like English and I study it every day.

sub_topics.title: 并列连词and合并句子
sub_topics.definition: 用and连接同一主语或相关句子
usage: 避免重复主语
examples: He stood up and left the room.

sub_topics.title: 连接词and的用法
sub_topics.definition: and用于连接并列的词、短语或句子。
usage: 连接并列成分
表示顺承关系

sub_topics.title: 并列连词and的用法
sub_topics.definition: 用于连接并列的词、短语或句子
usage: 连接两个并列成分
连接两个并列句
examples: He opened the door and went out.

sub_topics.title: 连接词的使用
sub_topics.definition: 连接词用于连接单词、短语或句子，使句子结构更完整、逻辑更清晰。
sub_topics.structure: 连词 + 单词 / 短语 / 句子
usage: 并列连词连接并列成分，如 and, but, or
从属连词引导从句，如 because, when, if, that
连接词后面可以接完整句子
避免句子之间缺少连接词导致结构错误
examples: He stayed at home because it was raining.
She knows that he is right.

grammar.title: 不定式 (to 动词原形)
grammar.definition: 由to + 动词原形构成的非谓语动词形式，可以作主语、宾语、表语、定语、状语和宾语补足语。
usage: 作宾语：I want to go home. / I decide to study hard.
作目的状语：I came here to see you.
作主语：To learn English well is important. = It is important to learn English well.
作宾语补足语：My mother asked me to clean the room.
作定语：I have something to tell you.

mistakes.explanation: make/let/have等使役动词后用省略to的不定式
感官动词see/hear/watch后用省略to的不定式或-ing

examples: She decided to become a doctor.
It's kind of you to help me.
I don't know what to do.

sub_topics.title: 不定式
sub_topics.definition: to do形式，可作多种成分
usage: 目的、宾语、主语

sub_topics.title: 不定式作宾语补足语
sub_topics.definition: to do形式在宾语后补充说明宾语。
sub_topics.structure: 动词 + sb. + to do sth.
usage: ask, tell, want等动词后
examples: I want you to help me.

sub_topics.title: 动词不定式作宾补
sub_topics.definition: 不定式补充说明宾语
sub_topics.structure: 动词 + 宾语 + to do
usage: 表示将要发生的动作
examples: She asked me to help her.

sub_topics.title: 不定式to do的用法
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: 动词不定式作宾语补足语
sub_topics.definition: 不定式用来补充说明宾语
sub_topics.structure: 动词 + sb. + to do sth.
usage: 常见于tell/ask/invite等动词后
examples: She asked me to help her.

grammar.title: 一般现在时
grammar.definition: 表示经常性、习惯性的动作或状态，也用于表示客观事实、真理和现在的状态。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 动词原形（第三人称单数加-s/-es）
usage: 表示经常性或习惯性动作：I get up at 6 every day.
表示客观事实或真理：The earth goes around the sun.
表示现在的状态或特征：She looks beautiful.
在时间/条件状语从句中表将来：If it rains tomorrow, I will stay at home.

mistakes.wrong: He go to school every day.
mistakes.correct: He goes to school every day.
mistakes.explanation: 第三人称单数主语后，动词要加-s或-es
第三人称单数的否定用doesn't，不用don't

sub_topics.title: 一般现在时第三人称单数
sub_topics.definition: 主语为第三人称单数时，谓语动词需变化
usage: 表示习惯或事实
examples: She goes to school by bike.

grammar.title: 主将从现
grammar.definition: 在条件状语从句和时间状语从句中 主句用一般将来时 从句用一般现在时表示将来
grammar.structure: 主句 will do 从句 一般现在时
usage: 常用于 if unless when before after 等引导的从句
从句中不能使用 will 表将来
examples: If it rains tomorrow, we will stay at home.
You will miss the bus unless you hurry up.

grammar.title: 过去进行时
grammar.definition: 表示过去某一时刻或某段时间正在进行的动作。
usage: 表示过去某时正在进行的动作：I was sleeping at 9 last night.
描述故事背景：The sun was shining and the birds were singing.
与when/while连用：I was doing homework when mom came back.

mistakes.wrong: I was watch TV at 8 yesterday.
mistakes.correct: I was watching TV at 8 yesterday.

mistakes.wrong: While I did homework, he was playing.
mistakes.correct: While I was doing homework, he was playing.
mistakes.explanation: while引导的从句常用进行时

examples: She was cooking when the phone rang.
What were you doing at this time yesterday?
They were playing basketball at 4 p.m.

sub_topics.title: 形容词+名词搭配
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: 形容词加名词构成名词短语
sub_topics.definition: 形容词修饰名词，构成完整名词短语
usage: 描述事物特征

sub_topics.title: 形容词加名词结构
sub_topics.definition: 非谓语

sub_topics.title: 形容词修饰名词的用法
sub_topics.definition: 非谓语

sub_topics.title: 形容词反义词构成
sub_topics.definition: 非谓语

grammar.title: until 的用法
grammar.definition: until 用来表示某个动作或状态持续到某一时间为止
grammar.structure: 主句 + until + 时间/句子
usage: 表示动作一直持续到某一时间
若主句是否定句，until 常表示“直到……才……”
examples: He waited until it got dark.
I didn’t realize the truth until he told me.

grammar.title: 情态动词
grammar.definition: 表示说话人的语气或态度的动词，后接动词原形，没有人称和数的变化。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 情态动词 + 动词原形
usage: can/could 表能力、许可、可能：I can swim. / Could you help me?
may/might 表许可、可能：May I come in? / It may rain.
must 表必须、肯定推测：You must finish it. / He must be at home.
should 表应该、建议：You should study hard.
need 表需要（否定needn't）：You needn't worry.

mistakes.explanation: 情态动词后接动词原形，不加-s

mistakes.wrong: Must I finish it? — No, you mustn't.
mistakes.correct: Must I finish it? — No, you needn't/don't have to.
mistakes.explanation: must的否定回答用needn't或don't have to，mustn't表禁止

mistakes.wrong: He must be not at home.
mistakes.explanation: must be的否定是can't be，不是must not be

examples: You must hand in your homework on time.

sub_topics.title: 双宾语结构
sub_topics.definition: 一个动词后接两个宾语
usage: tell, teach, give常见

sub_topics.title: 主语缺失问题
sub_topics.definition: 英语句子必须有明确主语
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + 谓语 + 宾语
usage: 不能用逗号连接两个完整句
必要时用it作形式主语
examples: It is important to protect nature.

grammar.title: 主谓结构
grammar.definition: 句子的基本结构，由主语和谓语构成，主语说明“谁”或“什么”，谓语说明主语“做什么”或“是什么”。
usage: 构成一个完整句子的最基本形式
谓语通常由动词或系动词加表语构成
判断句子是否完整时，先找主语和谓语动词

grammar.title: 固定搭配辨析
grammar.definition: 指某些词语在长期使用中形成固定组合，搭配不可随意更换，需要整体记忆。
grammar.structure: 动词/形容词/名词 + 固定介词或副词
usage: 不能随意替换其中的介词或副词
意义往往不同于单个词义简单相加
常见于动词短语和习惯表达

grammar.title: 用于否定句或否定短语
grammar.definition: (两者中)任何一方(的);两者之一的 pron.(两者中)任何一方；两者之一 adv.(用于否定句或否定短语)也(不)
